answers.answer: I feel for you I'm 36 weeks same problem :(  foot soaks with Epson salts help, I also have hot baths and run cold water on my feet for a bit, ummm ask you spouse for feet n leg rubs lots of pressure. .. stay hydrated  and also elevating both legs for 5-10 minutes
^^agree also massage and elevate your legs
Ha ha just realized you said elevate already

My dr told me , it sounds silly because yu swell when yur body retains water,  but drink more water.  Keep them proped up.  If it doesn't go down I'd call yur dr.  excessive Swelling is a sign of preeclampsia.

abnormal swelling is a sign of preclampsia  like if it happens in your face or if there's swelling in one leg but not the other, swelling is caused by water retention, and will increase if your on your feet alot

question: I am 35 weeks pregnant and my feet are really swollen .....they stay swallen all day. I elavate my feet and take plently off rest but still stay swollen any. Suggestions
title: What helps sweling feet
